message: The people who influence you are the people who believe in you.
author: Henry Drummond

message: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

message: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
author: W.Clement Stone

message: Happines is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Jim Rohn

message: The question isnt who is going to let me; its who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

message: Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

message: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

message: What would you do if you knew you could not fail?
author: Robert H. Schuller

message: It is the time that you wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

message: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

message: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

message: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

message: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if i wish to become a acquainted with the butterflies.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

message: Everything you have ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

message: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Ghandi

message: Todays accomplishments were yesterday’s impossibilities.
author: Robert H. Schuller

message: A negative mind will never give you a positive life.
author: Theodore Rosevelt

message: You become responsible, forever, for what you have taimed.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

message: In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.
author: Anne Frank

message: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

message: If you are going trough hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill
